[[Wi-Fi]] b/g/n/ac/6 | other = {{plainlist| * Physical sound volume keys * [[USB-C]]}} | sar = | hac = | website = {{url|https://www.samsung.com/global/galaxy/galaxy-z-flip/}} | references = }} The '''Samsung Galaxy Z Flip''' (sold as '''Samsung Galaxy Flip''' in certain territories) is an [[Android (operating system)|Android]]-based [[foldable smartphone]] developed by [[Samsung Electronics]]{{Cite news|url=https://www.theverge.com/2020/2/11/21128085/samsung-galaxy-z-flip-folding-glass-display-foldable-phone-unpacked-event|title=Samsung's Galaxy Z Flip has the first folding glass display|last=Kastrenakes|first=Jacob|date=2020-02-11|website=The Verge|language=en|access-date=2020-02-13}} as part of the [[Samsung Galaxy Z series]].{{Cite web|last=SamMobile|title=Samsung's foldable devices will fall under the Galaxy Z umbrella|url=https://www.sammobile.com/news/samsung-foldable-device-portfolio-new-naming-convention/|access-date=2020-07-11|website=SamMobile|date=12 February 2020 |language=en-US}} Its existence was first revealed in an advertisement during the [[92nd Academy Awards|2020 Academy Awards]].{{Cite news|url=https://www.cnn.com/2020/02/10/tech/samsung-galaxy-z-flip/index.html|title=Samsung unexpectedly shows off the Galaxy Z Flip|author=Jordan Valinsky|website=CNN|access-date=2020-02-11}} Unveiled alongside the [[Samsung Galaxy S20|Galaxy S20]] on February 11, 2020, it was released on February 14, 2020. Unlike the [[Samsung Galaxy Z Fold|Galaxy Z Fold]], the device folds horizontally and uses a hybrid glass coating branded as "Infinity Flex Display".{{Cite news|url=https://www.theverge.com/2020/2/11/21132345/samsung-galaxy-z-flip-foldable-phone-photos-videos-specs-price-hands-on|title=Samsung Galaxy Z Flip First Look: Folding Glass Changes Everything|work=[[The Verge]]|last=Bohn|first=Dieter|date=11 February 2020|access-date=11 February 2020}}{{Cite news|url=https://www.cnet.com/news/samsung-galaxy-z-flips-foldable-glass-screen-already-more-impressive-than-razr/|title=Samsung Galaxy Z Flip's foldable glass screen: Already more impressive than the Razr|work=[[CNET]]|last=Dolcourt|first=Jessica|date=13 February 2020|access-date=14 February 2020}}{{Cite news|url=https://arstechnica.com/gadgets/2020/02/the-galaxy-z-flip-launches-as-samsungs-answer-to-the-moto-razr/|title=Samsung's Galaxy Z Flip is the first foldable with a flexible glass cover|work=[[Ars Technica]]|last=Amadeo|first=Ron|date=11 February 2020|access-date=11 February 2020}} It is available in three colors for the LTE version (Mirror Purple, Mirror Black, and Mirror Gold) and two colors for the 5G version{{Cite web|last=Schoon|first=Ben|date=2020-07-22|title=Galaxy Z Flip 5G goes official w/ upgraded specs|url=https://9to5google.com/2020/07/22/samsung-galaxy-z-flip-5g-official-specs-price/|access-date=2020-08-08|website=[[9to5Google]]|language=en-US}} (Mystic Bronze and Mystic Gray). The 5G version was also made available in a limited-edition "Mystic White" color.{{Cite web|last=Davenport|first=Corbin|date=2020-11-30|title=Samsung debuts limited-edition 'Mystic Red' Galaxy Note20 and 'Mystic White' Z Flip 5G|url=https://www.androidpolice.com/2020/11/30/samsung-debuts-limited-edition-mystic-red-galaxy-note20-and-mystic-white-z-flip-5g/}} == Specifications == === Design === The Galaxy Z Flip is constructed with an aluminum frame, and {{convert|30|micron|in|abbr=on}}-thick "ultra-thin glass" with a plastic layer similar to the Galaxy Fold, manufactured by Samsung with materials from [[Schott AG]], which is "produced using an intensifying process to enhance its flexibility and durability", and injected with a "special material up to an undisclosed depth to achieve a consistent hardness"; conventional [[Gorilla Glass]] is used for the back panels.{{Cite web|url=https://www.theverge.com/2020/2/19/21142728/samsung-foldable-glass-galaxy-z-flip-explained-schott-corning|title=Folding Glass: how, why, and the truth of Samsung's Z Flip|last=Hollister|first=Sean|date=19 February 2020|work=[[The Verge]]|language=en|access-date=19 February 2020}} The Z Flip is the first foldable smartphone to use a glass display, while previous foldable phones such as the [[Motorola Razr (2020)|Motorola Razr]] and the Galaxy Fold have used plastic displays. Using a glass display results in a more durable screen, and reduces the screen crease in the folding point. The hinge mechanism is strengthened with nylon fibers designed to keep dust out; Samsung rated the fold mechanism as supporting up to 200,000 uses.{{Cite web|url=https://www.theverge.com/2020/2/11/21132345/samsung-galaxy-z-flip-foldable-phone-photos-videos-specs-price-hands-on|title=Hands on with Samsung's Galaxy Z Flip foldable phone|last=Bohn|first=Dieter|date=2020-02-11|website=The Verge|language=en|access-date=2020-02-14}} The device comes in 3 colors for the LTE version which are Mirror Purple, Mirror Black and Mirror Gold. It also comes in 2 colors for the 5G version which are Mystic Bronze and Mystic Gray. However, the color availability may vary depending on country or carrier. The Z Flip is also available in a Limited Edition [[Thom Browne]] model, featuring a red, white, and blue stripe on a gray base.{{Cite web|url=https://www.samsung.com/global/galaxy/galaxy-z-flip/specs/|title=Specs {{!}} Samsung Galaxy Z Flip|website=The Official Samsung Galaxy Site|language=en|access-date=2020-02-12}} === Hardware === The device uses a [[clamshell design]] to conceal a 6.7" [[21:9 aspect ratio|21:9]] Dynamic [[AMOLED]] display which supports HDR10+. The screen has a circular cutout at the top of the display for the front-facing camera. The exterior features a small 1.1" external display adjacent to the camera module, which can display the time, date and battery status, interact with notifications, answer phone calls and act as a viewfinder. The [[Qualcomm Snapdragon]] 855+ SoC and [[Adreno]] 640 GPU are utilized, with 8 GB of LPDDR4X RAM and 256 GB of non-expandable UFS 3.0 storage. It uses two batteries which have a total capacity of 3300 mAh, and can be recharged over USB-C at up to 15W wired or wirelessly via [[Qi (standard)|Qi]]. The power button is embedded in the frame and doubles as the fingerprint sensor, with the volume rocker located above. A dual camera setup on the rear has a 12 MP primary sensor and a 12 MP ultrawide sensor. The front-facing camera has a 10 MP sensor. === Software === {{See also|Android 10|One UI}} The Z Flip is pre-installed with [[Android 10]] and Samsung's [[One UI]] 2 skin. [[Split screen (computing)|Split-screen]] functionality, called "Flex mode" is supported with certain apps like [[YouTube]] and [[Google Duo]].{{Cite web|url=https://www.theverge.com/2020/2/11/21133907/samsung-galaxy-z-flip-google-split-screen-flex-mode-other-foldables|title=The Galaxy Z Flip's split-screen mode isn't just for Samsung foldables, says Google |work=[[The Verge]]|last=Peters|first=Jay|date=11 February 2020|access-date=14 February 2020}} ==Reception== The Z Flip was met with mixed to positive reviews at launch. It was praised for its flagship hardware, form factor, software/UI, display, and camera, but criticized for the price, size of the cover display, and perceived overall fragility. Sascha Segan of ''[[PC Magazine]]'' gave the Z Flip a 3/5, stating that "the Samsung Galaxy Z Flip is the first folding phone to really work, but it's still a costly and potentially fragile fashion object rather than a mainstream hit".{{Cite web|url=https://www.pcmag.com/reviews/samsung-galaxy-z-flip|title=Samsung Galaxy Z Flip Review|work=[[PC Magazine]]|last=Segan|first=Sascha|date=19 February 2020|access-date=19 February 2020}} Jessica Dolcourt of ''[[CNET]]'' gave the Z Flip a 7.9/10, calling it "a cohesive device that's easy to pick up and use right away". Dolcourt called Flex Mode "the most unique, interesting and effective feature by far", while noting that battery life was just average and most multimedia was incompatible with the device's aspect ratio, resulting in [[pillarbox]]ing.{{Cite web|url=https://www.cnet.com/reviews/samsung-galaxy-z-flip-review/|title=Galaxy Z Flip review: Samsung's killer feature is its freestanding screen|work=[[CNET]]|last=Dolcourt|first=Jessica|date=20 February 2020|access-date=20 February 2020}} Chris Velazco of ''[[Engadget]]'' gave it a 78, praising the form factor, performance and cameras while criticizing the cover display and overall fragility.{{Cite web|url=https://www.engadget.com/2020/02/21/samsung-galaxy-z-flip-review/|title=Samsung Galaxy Z Flip review: Admire it, don't buy it|work=[[Engadget]]|last=Velazco|first=Chris|date=21 February 2020|access-date=23 February 2020}}{{cite web |last1=Welch |first1=Chris |title=Galaxy Z Flip durability test calls Samsung's Ultra Thin 'Glass' into question |url=https://www.theverge.com/2020/2/16/21139897/samsung-galaxy-z-flip-ultra-thin-glass-durability-scratch-test-jerryrigeverything |website=The Verge |date=16 February 2020 |access-date=16 Feb 2020}} Dieter Bohn of ''[[The Verge]]'' gave the Z Flip a 6/10, concluding that "as with previous [[Foldable smartphone|folding phones]] it is more of an expensive experiment than a real product anybody should buy". Bohn praised the performance and hinge design, but was critical of the price and cameras, noting that the screen’s plastic covering was still susceptible to scratches.{{Cite web|url=https://www.theverge.com/2020/2/21/21146465/samsung-galaxy-z-flip-review-folding-glass-flip-phone-screen-camera-price|title=Galaxy Z Flip review: temper your expectations|work=[[The
